engine.rendering.opengl

Class OpenGLRenderDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • engine.rendering.opengl.OpenGLRenderDevice
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IRenderDevice

    public class OpenGLRenderDevice
extends java.lang.Object
implements IRenderDevice
    A device that is capable of OpenGL rendering
    Author:
    Benny Bobaganoosh (thebennybox@gmail.com)

        Description copied from interface: IRenderDevice
        Releases any resources being used. This object should not be used after this is called.
        Specified by:

      • createTexture

        public int createTexture(int width,
                int height,
                ArrayBitmap image,
                int filter)
        Description copied from interface: IRenderDevice
        Creates a texture that can be used by the device. It is preferred to use this through the Texture class when possible.
        Specified by:
        createTexture in interface IRenderDevice
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the texture, in pixels.
        height - The height of the texture, in pixels.
        image - The image being used as a texture.
        filter - The filter used when sampling the image. Should be one of the IRenderDevice.FILTER options.
        Returns:
        An integer identifying the texture on this device.

      • releaseTexture

        public int releaseTexture(int id)
        Description copied from interface: IRenderDevice
        Releases and invalidates a texture. The value of id will be invalid after this call and may be reused to identify a new texture. Note that this does nothing when the null id, 0, is given for id.

        It is preferred to use this through the Texture class when possible.

        Specified by:
        releaseTexture in interface IRenderDevice
        Parameters:
        id - The integer identifying the texture to be released.
        Returns:
        The null id of 0.

      • getTexture

        public ArrayBitmap getTexture(int id,
                     int x,
                     int y,
                     int width,
                     int height)
        Description copied from interface: IRenderDevice
        Gets a texture, in whole or in part, from this device. It is preferred to use this through the Texture class when possible.
        Specified by:
        getTexture in interface IRenderDevice
        Parameters:
        id - The integer identifying the texture to be gotten.
        x - The x location to start getting the texture from.
        y - The y location to start getting the texture from.
        width - How many pixels should be read on x.
        height - How many pixels should be read on y.
        Returns:
        An ArrayBitmap storing the read portion of the texture.

      • createRenderTarget

        public int createRenderTarget(int width,
                     int height,
                     int texId)
        Description copied from interface: IRenderDevice
        Creates a render target that can be used by this device. It is preferred to use this through the RenderTarget class when possible.
        Specified by:
        createRenderTarget in interface IRenderDevice
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the render target, in pixels.
        height - The height of the render target, in pixels.
        texId - The integer identifying the texture being used for rendering.
        Returns:
        An integer identifying the render target on this device.

      • releaseRenderTarget

        public int releaseRenderTarget(int fbo)
        Description copied from interface: IRenderDevice
        Releases and invalidates a render target. The value of fbo will be invalid after this call and may be reused to identify a new render target. Note that this does nothing when the null id, 0, is given for fbo.

        It is preferred to use this through the RenderTarget class when possible.

        Specified by:
        releaseRenderTarget in interface IRenderDevice
        Parameters:
        fbo - The integer identifying the render target to be released.
        Returns:
        The null id of 0.

      • clear

        public void clear(int fbo,
         Color color)
        Description copied from interface: IRenderDevice
        Clears a render target to a single color. It is preferred to use this through the RenderTarget class when possible.
        Specified by:
        clear in interface IRenderDevice
        Parameters:
        fbo - The integer identifying the render target.
        color - The color to clear to.

      • drawRect

        public void drawRect(int fbo,
            int texId,
            IRenderDevice.BlendMode mode,
            double startX,
            double startY,
            double endX,
            double endY,
            double texStartX,
            double texStartY,
            double texEndX,
            double texEndY,
            Color c,
            double transparency)
        Description copied from interface: IRenderDevice
        Produces a rendering effect within a rectangle. It is preferred to use this through the RenderTarget class when possible.
        Specified by:
        drawRect in interface IRenderDevice
        Parameters:
        fbo - The integer identifying the render target.
        texId - The integer identifying the texture being used for rendering.
        mode - The blend mode being used
        startX - The start location on X, normalized into the range (-1, 1)
        startY - The start location on Y, normalized into the range (-1, 1)
        endX - The end location on X, normalized into the range (-1, 1)
        endY - The end location on Y, normalized into the range (-1, 1)
        texStartX - The location in the image on X where pixels should begin being copied, normalized into the range (0, 1)
        texStartY - The location in the image on Y where pixels should begin being copied, normalized into the range (0, 1)
        texEndX - The location in the image on X where pixels should finish being copied, normalized into the range (0, 1)
        texEndY - The location in the image on Y where pixels should finish being copied, normalized into the range (0, 1)
        c - The color masking everything.
        transparency - The amount of transparency being used.
